(10) Letters and Memorials
On such-and-such date, monk so-and-so respectfully sends this letter to the secretarial court of Yan Chang.
Previously, I was honored by Yan Chang, the Marquis of Guan,
and received Qian Zi's teachings on assisting the ruler, which I joyfully agreed with.
He left a letter discussing the Way of Great Sincerity with over a hundred words.
Then we praised each other too much.
But because Qian Zi was traveling west with Yan Chang,
he was just sending a letter to the chancellor.
He fully promoted this Way.
He was afraid that the letter would not fully express his thoughts.
He further described Yan Chang's meeting with the chancellor,
and added his words.
The Way of Great Sincerity is the ultimate Way of the sages.
When the Way of Great Sincerity is practiced, one does not consider the world to be close or distant.
One does not regard loyalty and filial piety as a matter of power and profit.
It is that ministers should be loyal and sons should be filial.
Those who can be close should be made close.
Those who can be distant are made distant.
These are all things that Yao and Shun have experienced.
However, the Way of the Great Public is fundamentally based on sincerity and clarity.
The sage preserves sincerity in order to communicate with Heaven and Earth.
The sage gives rise to clarity in order to unite with the ultimate of the emperor.
It is like what the Doctrine of the Mean says:
Joy, anger, sorrow, and pleasure are not yet manifested, this is called the center.
When they are manifested and all are in moderation, this is called harmony.
The center is the great foundation of the world.
Harmony is the thoroughfare of the world.
The reason why Yao and Shun attained their Way
is because they were able to be sincere and clear and uphold their foundation.
As for the Way of sincerity and clarity, even the sages find it difficult.
Confucius said:
When the Great Way is practiced,
I have not yet attained it,
but I have aspirations for it.
In later generations, loyalty and filial piety are used to encourage and admire, and then loyalty and filial piety are used to show off and flaunt.
Yet those who seek power and profit, and are loyal and filial, compete in creating confusion and disorder, spreading it all over the world.
Those who are truly loyal and truly filial, who do not flatter or flatter others,
how can they be mixed up with them for a whole life?
How can they clear themselves?
Those who are proud and arrogant also think that the minds of others are the same as their own.
They no longer believe that there is such a thing as sincerity.
Therefore, the way of sincerity and clarity is completely lost.
The foundation of the way of great impartiality,
is also no longer known.
How much less can one keep and uphold it?
Yan Chang alone is able to resolutely promote sincerity and clarity and uphold the way of great impartiality.
How could it be that he naturally attains his loftiness and distance?
It is not so because of his study and practice.
Since the book of Qianzi has been published,
the scholars and gentlemen only praise its good writing.
I can roughly read the books of the hundred schools.
Du Yanchang said that I keep my mind on the Great Public.
His letter is diligent and sincere.
If one does not deeply understand and know the Way,
how can one be like this?
Now the Great Sage and the Great Wise gather in the court.
Just using the Way of the Great Public to govern the world.
It is appropriate for Du Yanchang to shake its original source.
With the Way of sincerity and clarity, to drive the teachings.
To assist in its teachings and transformations.
Then the meritorious and virtuous deeds will be greatly effective.
Strive for it! Strive for it!
Not announced.
So-and-so respectfully reports.

Recently, I was honored to receive your handwritten letter.
Praising it as extremely wonderful.
Modestly considering not knowing each other as a regret.
What kind of person am I?
At this great kindness, I am very fortunate, very fortunate.
I am originally mediocre and self-measured, unable to find peace in my mind.
I sought the teachings of the sages and took them as good.
Having studied my own way, I also explored Confucian techniques.
Having gained something from both, I secretly used literary expressions to expound them.
But the wise and powerful of the world did not reject me for my presumptuous and wild compositions.
They still considered me worth talking to and befriending.
Although I associated with them and became close friends,
I never fully expressed my mind to them.
This is because in teaching people, there are rarely no disagreements.
Even if I wanted to speak about it, I looked at myself.
How could my words be necessarily trusted by the world?
Therefore, I always sighed with distress.
I was not quite satisfied with myself.
When I saw the preface written by the monk Ying for the secret school,
he also said that Buddhism teaches people to do good and benefits the world.
He did not follow the crowd in slandering and criticizing each other.
This is not because he is far-sighted and sees the sages' profound mind.
Then how could he have such an ultimate discussion?
Without waiting to know each other, I firmly believe that your discernment is outstanding and far surpasses your contemporaries.
I should pour out my thoughts and intentions and discuss it with you.
Moreover, you have the honor of writing.
Only the Way and literature can humble themselves and be willing to love each other.
Even if one is prosperous and has morality like the monks of ancient times who were lofty in the world,
one should greatly advance their teachings to broaden the aspirations of the Secretariat.
How much more so for my humble self in this situation.
How can I remain silent and keep it to myself?
The Way of the Buddha is great and profound.
If it is promoted and practiced, there is nothing that is not acceptable.
If it is used to exhaust the principles and fulfill one's nature,
it can enable people to fully understand the spirit beyond life and death, transformation,
Even the Way of the Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors,
has never reached it.
This is truly not something that those who manage the world can speculate about.
If it is used to govern the world and guide the secular,
it can enable people to have a compassionate heart, purify the body, change goodness, avoid offenses, stop disputes, and not kill, thereby pacifying the country and the world.
The teachings of the five precepts and ten wholesome deeds, as well as the five constant virtues and benevolence and righteousness,
are of one essence but have different names.
This is what those who engage in conditioned activities should uphold.
In ancient and modern times, many Confucians have debated this.
They all do not fathom its basis and equate it with its superficial aspects.
They simply consider those who follow Buddhism to be excessive and go too far.
And they say all sorts of things about it, criticizing it in a hundred ways.
Alas, Shun took pleasure in learning from others and considered it good.
Yu, upon hearing good words, would bow.
Confucius chose the good and followed it.
Yan Yuan, upon hearing a single good word, would respectfully accept it and dare not fail to put it into practice.
The ancient sages and worthies led the later generations in this way.
Yet the people of later generations still cannot follow it.
There are those who go against it, causing chaos, losing their nature, destroying themselves, breaking their families, and bringing down their countries.
How much more so for falsely denouncing the good path and discouraging people?
To do it like this,
how can it be used to encourage later generations?
Alas! If people of later generations do not all do good,
It is also the fault of those who argue falsely.
The Secretarial Court is now acting for the state in governing.
If it can indeed promote this to extend the Way of Yao and Shun,
Then it will be governing and ruling.
Is it not even greater and more far-reaching?
I am writing this to express my thoughts in the wind as a reply.
To thank you for your kind intention.
I will not elaborate.
I, so-and-so, respectfully state.

His trustworthiness with others.

I have heard that the learning of the superior person wishes to deeply explore its Way.
Deep exploration wishes for it to be self-realized.
If one has self-realization in the Way,
then what it gives rise to will be unsurpassed.
What is called the Way is what is meant by benevolence and righteousness.
Benevolence and righteousness come from human nature.
All people are born with it, but those who do not reach benevolence and righteousness do not study.
Those who study but do not self-realize it
are because their learning is shallow and their practice is not correct.ğŸ”½As for the sage and the worthy, although their praise is different,
how can the reason for being a sage or worthy be different?ğŸ”½The sage attains it through sincerity and clarity,

When it comes to benevolence and righteousness, it is the same.
It shows that his learning is profound and he has attained something on his own.
Therefore, his literary expressions are excellent.
As Han Yu said, The words of a person with benevolence and righteousness are as luxuriant as this.
The ten chapters of the text.

Is especially good, compared to what the world calls literature, it is insignificant.

And my understanding and thoughts became barely correct.

I, a poor monk, am even less acceptable to others.
How can this be suitable for abandoning my Way and wanting to steal praise from the wise with my meager literary talent?

Therefore, when I received your gift,
I almost threw away the letter and wept, saying:
Now the Son of Heaven is greatly enlightened, far-sighted, and knowledgeable.

Can it be that you also blame the teaching path for the faults of the unworthy?
You have also seen me practicing Buddhism.

If you say it is not yet perfect,
you should encourage it with the virtue of monks.

and only see the teaching in the written words,
then I dare not listen.

Please remove it.
I respectfully accept every excellent statement.

I am moved by this to think of the past and present, there are those who have extraordinary thoughts and abilities, but in the end they sink and are abandoned in the weeds, no different from ordinary stones, how many are there?
Although such people may possess extraordinary talents and knowledge,
they have no one who understands them.
They can only be with the ordinary and vulgar, above and below them.
If they encounter a student who is not jealous of them but slanders them,
that would be their good fortune.

Alas, in the world, there are many who do not enjoy the goodness of others.
If you take up the matter and do not discard the beauty of a single thing,
you will still be praised by literature and words in the world.
Truly, your mind and capacity are straightforward and surpass hundreds of thousands of others.
If you were to obtain a position in the imperial court,
and extend this mind to others,
then the people of the world who are drowning and mingling with the vulgar,
who would not be able to display their talents and work?

Letter to the Gentleman-in-Attendance Zhou Gan-zhi, Letter to the Gentleman-in-Attendance Zhou Gan-zhi, I respectfully receive the letter from the Gentleman-in-Attendance Gan-zhi.

would not change even if he lived his whole life.

Alas, the virtuous father's intention
It is also far from the truth.

Moreover, this effect is absolutely impossible.
It inspires people to study and not forget the way and righteousness.
How could they not think of the Book of Changes, which says that burial only takes the meaning of excessive thickness?
Mencius said:
Filial sons cover their parents.

As for the three dynasties, they feared that the noble and humble would encroach upon each other, and extravagance and frugality would go too far.

This is why I do not accept what is moved by.

As a filial son and grandson,

For generations to come, none will compare to him.
This is truly due to the accumulated virtue of his ancestors.
Now, those who are moved to consider their descendants,
Should think of loyalty, filial piety, benevolence, and righteousness.
If there is anything that has not been attained, then strive to attain it.
The petty theories of the yin and yang masters,

I admire the good character and magnanimity of those who are moved, which has the style of the ancients.
But I am greatly afraid that there will be some loss in this.
Therefore, I dare not remain silent about its pros and cons.
You should further consider it.
If you claim to have a different view,
I will follow your intention.
This is not something I dare to know.
The rest I will discuss further when we meet.
